definition: Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC
summer
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: In Xia Dynasty, the rulers bestowed rewards in court in order to make eminent the good.
sentences.chinese: 夏代在朝廷上奖励有功的人，是为了鼓励好人。

sentences.english: According to the ancient document the city may be the capital of the early Xia dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 根据文献记载，该遗址应是夏代早期都城夏邑所在。

sentences.english: The Xia Dynasty began a period of family or clan control.
sentences.chinese: 夏代开始，为期家庭或部族控制。

sentences.english: There exists a debate as to whether or not Erlitou culture was the site of the Xia dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 存在着争论，不论是二里头文化遗址的夏代。

definition: the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
Zhou dynasty (1046-221 BC)
Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
BCE (before the Common Era)/BC (before Christ)
Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Erlitou (Xia dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 chao2] archaeological site at Yanshi 偃師|偃师[Yan3 shi1] in Luoyang 洛陽|洛阳[Luo4 yang2], Henan)
Longshan culture/black pottery culture
Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
